data.title: Cher: ‘My record label don’t care about me’
data.meta_description: Cher has claimed that her label Warner Records no longer cares about her. Read next Omar Apollo on emotional intensity, infatuation, and why he’s more than just a brooding heartthrob Discover joy in the everyday: Moschino’s ‘Collezione O’ campaign shows a new chapter under Adrian Appiolaza The singer took to Twitter to respond to criticism […]
data.text:
Cher has claimed that her label Warner Records no longer cares about her.

The singer took to Twitter to respond to criticism of her latest single Take It Like A Man.

After reading a review of the song and its accompanying remix music video, Cher tweeted: “Just read mean TILAM [‘Take It Like A Man’] review.

“The video had nothing 2 do with me.I was told it would only be shown in gay bars.It’s true WB’s hasn’t got a Great Deal of Interest In My CD.

“Not ALL,THERE R HARD WORKING ADORABLE PPL.,But Decision Makers Don’t Seem 2CareThat Much. It’s Ok YHSTLOM.”

We would like to add that Take It Like A Man and its accompanying remix video is amazing, and we will not hear otherwise (check it out below).

> Cher and Cyndi Lauper going on tour together

> David Guetta covers Cher for new single
